data.title: Workspaces aren't restored properly
data.body:
* have two VS Code windows open, both showing a workspace/folder
* exit
* delete one of the workspaces/folders
* restart
* ðŸ› Instead of showing the other/remaining workspace an empty workspace/no folder is shown

data.title: Mac can be cases-sensitive
data.body:
re #16544

> Backup files with same string but different casing on Linux (as the file system is case sensitive), make sure there are no collisions

This is more FYI that also on macOS case-sensitive file systems exist. The default is insensitive but it's easy to change. Unsure if hot-exit will handle that gracefully?

data.title: Editor preview tab auto-close, when navigating out of it
data.body:
When you click on file and have preview tab opened (header of tab is in italic), it would be nice, if VSCode is closing it automatically, when you navigate out of it (clicking on tab header of another opened filed).
There should also be an option in configurations to turn this off.
"workbench.editor.enablePreviewAutoClose": true - default value

data.title: Move PHP IntelliSense out of core
data.body:
https://github.com/felixfbecker/php-language-server has recently gained advanced completion support which goes way beyond VS Code's internal PHP completion. It resolves types, looks at docblocks and suggests everything from classes, properties, methods etc. depending on context. Validation is also implemented.

It is currently blocked by https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/issues/127, but after that I plan to release it. The problem though is that there is no way to disable the built-in completion and snippets for PHP, so you will get a lot of duplicated results (because the built-in completion is not context-aware).

Since PHP is the only language that has bundled completion and validation, I would propose to just remove it from core (only keep syntax highlighting).

@mousetraps

data.title: Git Clone: do simple validation of user input
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16505

I suggest to validate the input of the git clone operation to be a valid URL to prevent bogus input like this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/20920378/086fb46c-bba0-11e6-827d-b4164e0861fa.png)

data.title: Git Clone: do the clone operation from the window

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16505

The new "Git Clone" operation works fine but I wonder if it should work differently:
* you run the command
* you are being asked for a URL to clone
* you are asked for a folder to clone to
* a window opens on that folder
* the terminal opens running the clone operation

/cc @chrisdias

data.title: Add Configuration screws up launch.json
Unable to write to settings should offer an action to open settings
data.body:
1. Have an error in your user settings
2. View > hide activity bar
3. Notice an error that we are unable to write to settings and that the user should fix them

This error should have an action to open settings as most users have a hard time finding settings.

![screen shot 2016-12-06 at 10 31 13](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/20920193/495d4e90-bb9f-11e6-816d-f7b59005e8f7.png)

data.title: some problems of "tasks.json"
data.body: - VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:01:10.756Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0 - Extensions: |Extension|Author|Version| |---|---|---| |cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.2| --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. ```js { "version": "0.1.0", "command": "make", "suppressTaskName": true, "tasks": [ { "taskName": "Release-Build", "isBuildCommand": true, "args": ["CC=gcc"] } ] } ``` Run Task: Release-Build 2. ```js { "version": "0.1.0", "command": "make", "suppressTaskName": true, "osx": { "tasks": [ { "taskName": "Release-Build", "isBuildCommand": true, "args": ["CC=gcc"] } ] } } ``` Run Task: make Release-Build

data.title: `showTabCloseButton` is confusing
data.body:
#15810

The first time I experimented with this setting, its value was reversed. I could see the buttons when it was set to `false` and they would go away when it was set to `true`. This reproduced **always** in that session. When I reloaded the window, that behaviour was gone! ðŸ˜•

data.title: Opening a file always opens two windows
data.body:
We've been like this for as long as I can remember, but I just realised how annoying it is.

In Windows, have Code closed and:

1. Double click a file

or

1. Run `code-insiders file`

You **always** get two windows open: one empty and one with the file. We should only get one.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/20918117/ac355526-bb95-11e6-97c5-9a4ef4d529e8.png)

data.title: Extension API: insertSpaces and tabSize are undefined
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Build an extension and access `window.activeTextEditor.options`.
2. The `insertSpaces` and `tabSize` are undefined.

Extra Information:

- This happens when `editor.detectIndentation` is true.
- A semi accurate workaround could be done by using `workspace.getConfiguration`.

data.title: Editor scrolls to the wrong place when navigating to a lower line in the same file using the inline editor
data.body:
- Open any file, let's say `workbench.ts` in vscode
- Do 'find all references' on something, like `this.initServices()` on line 247
- Double click or press enter on the listing for the other reference, to navigate to it

It should be showing line 402, but the editor has actually scrolled just past line 402.

If the navigation goes up, it works correctly.

If the navigation goes across files, it works correctly. It reproes anywhere that the navigation goes downwards within the same file.

data.title: Win/Linux: detect real casing of workspace paths
data.body:
In insiders, I had a workspace opening with a lowercase workspaceRoot path, so that file paths were reported as lowercased, and `${workspaceRoot}` in a launch config was replaced with a lowercase version which is how I noticed. I opened and closed vscode several times and it persisted. And it persisted through opening that folder again with the 'recently opened' list. I opened the folder again using cmd+o, and then it had the correct casing. I assume that the list of recently opened folders got the lowercased path somehow. Any idea how it could have happened? It's not reproing anymore unfortunately. 

I debugged it as far as the function `startup` in main.ts and saw that it was lowercased at that point.

Should be uppercased `/Users`
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/20915161/f0635f2a-bb38-11e6-80bd-e23d7c2616fe.png)

data.title: Presing Tab key after a word in markdown file creates XML tags
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2 (7ba55c58)
- OS Version: Windows 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a `test.md` file
2. Add a sentence of text such as 

        Lorem ipsum sit dolar amet.

3. Put your keyboard cursor after `Lorem`
4. Press <kbd>Tab</kbd>

Expected: Spaces or tabs to be added between `Lorem` and `ipsum`
Result: `Lorem` word gets converted into an XML tag and auto closed, leaving us with

        <Lorem></Lorem> ipsum sit dolar amet.

### In Action

![in action](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3955052/20914967/0d655710-bbd7-11e6-9a10-6fbc13886549.gif)

data.title: Apply indent rule when enter.
data.body:
Apply indent rule when users type. For instance, since not all languages uses brackets as block, some languages are using `decreaseIndentRule` to adjust indentation.

Take Ruby as example

![ruby-indentation](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/20914835/fa4d0b96-bb36-11e6-9997-65292ef52774.gif)

- OS Version: macOS Sierra
- go version: go1.7.3

extensions: 
 ![extension](http://ww1.sinaimg.cn/large/73c5712dgw1fagy7tsv5gj20bi0dudgh.jpg)
